title: How to Write A Great Meet Cute
author: Think Story

"Sorry, I got my q-tip in your meat."
"I got my meat on your q-tip."
"So it's kinda like a meet cute."
Such lovable dorks.
I love how you point out that the meet cute should introduce the main conflict for the couple. I'll be sure to use that in my novel.

I'm a bit annoyed at people complaining about movies where meetcutes happen just becuse it's a troupe.
EVERYTHING IS A TROUPE!
THe characters has to meet in some way otherwise it will be a pretty un-engaging love story.
Romance has always been difficult for me to understand in writing, this really broke it down, thanks!
description:
"Meet Cutes" can be found in thousands of famous films, providing us with memorable scenes that set up some of the most iconic stories of all time. In this episode I explore the different types of meet cutes, how they are written, and what goes in to making one memorable.
